meanings.sent1: The stenotic pipe limited the flow of water.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient with a stenotic artery.
meanings.sent3: The stenotic doorway caused a traffic jam in the hallway.
meanings.sent4: Her stenotic view of the world made her hesitant to try new things.
meanings.sent5: The stenotic opening in the fence was too small for the cat to squeeze through.

meanings.sent1: The stenotic blood vessel required immediate attention.
meanings.sent2: The stenotic valve in the heart was causing problems.
meanings.sent3: The stenotic road led to a frustratingly slow drive.
meanings.sent4: His stenotic beliefs made it hard for him to accept different opinions.
meanings.sent5: The stenotic tunnel was too tight for the truck to pass through.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a narrowing or constriction
meanings.sent1: The stenotic condition of the pipe needed urgent repair.
meanings.sent2: The stenotic airway made breathing difficult for the patient.
meanings.sent3: The stenotic budget forced them to cut back on expenses.
meanings.sent4: Her stenotic mindset prevented her from seeing other possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The stenotic opening in the wall was too small for the cable to fit through.
